title: doesn't work
comment: needs dashboard that no longer seems to be supported so I can't use it
Why does this require camera permissions?

title: Discontinued
comment: The whole sparkleshare project seems to be discontinued. I think it will become a cloud payed service :( Centralized and cloud services are killing informatic knowledge of people and open source filosophy.

title: Sparkleshare-Dashboard discontinued
comment: This software relies on sparkleshare-dashboard which has been discontinued and removed from github, as a result this android client is useless if you are setting up sparkleshare in a private server for the first time.

title: Stop complain about needing the dashboard
comment: The dashboard is what lets you access individual files without having to download the whole git repo to your phone. Its a restriction of how git is distributed, not server based like svn.

title: Why the dashboard?
comment: Thank you for your great effort, but I would like to avoid having to use the dashboard and access my files directly via SSH. The dashbord solution is absolutely cumbersome both on the cvlient and server side.

title: Love the effort
comment: But why the dashboard thing ? Wish I could fetch directly through ssh..

title: Why using the Dashboard?
comment: I have a Git repo with SSH access properly configured, but I have to install that unstable Sparkleshare Dashboard in order to run this app. Why?

title: Excellent
comment: Lovely. Just need the ability to sens to the share from the phone and it will be perfect. I think it is in the roadmap already.

title: Great start!
comment: The application looks fantastic! If there's one thing I wish we could do is upload files to a repo. I'm sure it's in the roadmap, but I'd like to restate it.

title: Excellent
comment: This will be the king of self owned sync.
